dev-genesis.name: Dev Genesis
dev-genesis.description: A comprehensive starter template that helps devs plan their project by setting up GitHub issues, actions, and AI tools.
dev-genesis.problem: Starting a new software project wastes hours on repetitive setup tasks—configuring Git, setting up issue templates, configuring AI assistants, establishing workflows, and implementing quality tooling. Developers spend entire afternoons on boilerplate configuration instead of writing code. By the time the repository is properly structured, momentum and excitement have already faded.
dev-genesis.solution: Dev Genesis is a GitHub template repository that handles all project setup automatically. In under 30 minutes, it generates a fully-configured repository with AI planning prompts that create importable GitHub issues, pre-configured support for Claude Code, Cursor, Copilot, and Windsurf, automated security scanning, and professional workflows. Developers go from rough idea to organized, production-ready project structure instantly—then start coding immediately.
target_audience: Solo Developers wanting to launch projects quickly without tedious setup
Tech lead at a startup needing to bootstrap new repositories for rapid prototyping
Freelance developers juggling multiple projects who need to save time on setup
Open-source maintainers looking to standardize project structures across repositories
Development agencies aiming to streamline project kickoffs for client work
Hobbyist programmers eager to turn ideas into code without friction
dev-genesis.mission_statement: Dev Genesis exists to eliminate the friction between inspiration and implementation. Every hour spent on repository setup is an hour stolen from actual building. Our mission is to give developers back their time and momentum by automating the tedious configuration work that stands between great ideas and great code, making it possible to go from concept to coding in minutes instead of days.

vibiom.name: Vibiom
vibiom.post_mvp_type: Desktop Application and Web Dashboard / SaaS
vibiom.description: Vibiom is an autonomous AI development platform that transforms software specifications into production-ready applications through coordinated multi-agent orchestration. The full platform features 15-20 specialized base agents (product management, architecture, security, frontend, backend, testing, DevOps, etc.), with users able to generate custom agents on-the-fly for specific project needs. A built-in agent marketplace allows users to share and monetize specialized agents they've created. Vibiom includes an intelligent task board that AI agents control autonomously while remaining transparent and interactive for human oversight, plus real-time dashboards showing test pass rates, development velocity, and project health metrics. Rather than replacing developers, Vibiom acts as an autonomous engineering team—handling implementation while developers focus on strategy, architecture decisions, and quality oversight. Solo developers gain the output of an entire engineering organization; small teams scale like enterprises.
vibiom.monetization_strategy: SaaS Subscription with Tiered Plans and Agent Marketplace
vibiom.problem: Solo developers and small teams want to build ambitious products but can't afford full engineering organizations. Existing AI coding tools (Cursor, Claude Code) help write code faster, but they're single-agent assistants - you still do all the architecture, security review, testing, and coordination yourself. More autonomous tools like Devin and Replit handle simple tasks but fail at complex, production-grade development because they lack specialized expertise. No tool gives solo developers the coordinated capabilities of an entire engineering team - where a product manager breaks down requirements, a backend engineer implements, a security engineer reviews, and a QA engineer validates, all working together autonomously.
vibiom.solution: Vibiom is an AI orchestrator that coordinates specialized agents to build production-grade software - and it's being built to eventually improve itself. Starting as a CLI tool with three agents (Product → Backend → Security), it proves that multi-agent coordination produces better code than single-agent systems. Each agent specializes in one domain, validates previous work, and hands off to the next agent through structured workflows. As the system matures and proves reliable, Vibiom will dogfood itself - using its own multi-agent coordination to add features, expand capabilities, and refine its orchestration. The endgame: an AI engineering team that grows its own capabilities, starting with secure REST APIs and eventually handling complete application development.
target_audience: Solo developers wanting to build complex products without a full engineering team
Small startups needing to rapidly prototype and iterate on software ideas
Freelance developers looking to scale their output and take on larger projects
Tech-savvy entrepreneurs aiming to launch software products with minimal coding
Development agencies seeking to augment their teams with autonomous AI agents
vibiom.mission_statement: Vibiom exists to prove that coordinated AI specialists can build better software than single AI generalists - and to build itself using that same coordination. Solo developers shouldn't choose between autocomplete tools that make them faster coders and autonomous agents that produce mediocre code. Our mission is to demonstrate that specialized AI agents, each expert in their domain and working through peer review, produce production-grade code that single-agent systems can't match. We're starting small - three agents building secure APIs - because the foundation must be excellent before we scale. By dogfooding Vibiom to build Vibiom, we'll create an AI engineering organization that improves itself, giving solo developers the coordinated expertise of an entire team without the cost or complexity of hiring one.

tempered_ui.name: TemperedUI
tempered_ui.description: TemperedUI is a security-first React component library that makes secure development effortless and fast. It provides beautiful, accessible components with built-in protection against XSS, CSRF, and injection attacks. Features include auto-sanitizing inputs, secure forms with automatic token management, and safe links that prevent tabnabbing—all styled with Tailwind CSS. Built by an application security professional, TemperedUI eliminates the need to write security code manually for common UI patterns. Developers can ship secure, production-ready applications faster with components that protect by default while maintaining modern design standards and accessibility compliance.
post_mvp_technologies: Custom secure wrappers around chart libraries
tempered_ui.monetization_strategy: Freemium with Paid Plans for Advanced Components and Enterprise Features
tempered_ui.problem: Building secure web applications requires developers to manually implement protection against XSS, CSRF, injection attacks, and other vulnerabilities for every input, form, and link. Security code is repetitive, easy to forget, and constantly needs updating as new attack vectors emerge. Most component libraries prioritize aesthetics over security, leaving developers to bolt on protection themselves—often incorrectly.
tempered_ui.solution: TemperedUI is a React component library where security is built into every component by default. Inputs auto-sanitize, forms include CSRF token management, links prevent tabnabbing, and all components are designed by an application security professional. Developers get beautiful, accessible, Tailwind-styled components that protect against common vulnerabilities automatically—no manual security code required.
target_audience: Full-stack developers building web applications who want secure components out-of-the-box
Frontend developers needing accessible, well-designed UI components with built-in security
Startups and small teams looking to ship secure applications faster without dedicated security experts
Freelance developers wanting to ensure their applications are secure without extra effort
Development agencies aiming to deliver secure, production-ready applications to clients quickly
tempered_ui.mission_statement: TemperedUI exists because security should never be an afterthought developers bolt on manually. Our mission is to make secure development the default path by building React components where protection is built into the foundation—not a feature you remember to add. We believe beautiful, accessible interfaces and robust security aren't competing priorities; they're inseparable standards that every application deserves.
